alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:31AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Crawford, southwestern Washington, northeastern Sequoyah, Adair and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 731 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Proctor to 5 miles south of Cookson. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Stilwell... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Prairie Grove... West Fork... Lincoln... Westville... Greenland... Winslow... Chester... Adair State Park... Christie... Blackburn... Maryetta... Cookson... Lee Creek... Cherokee Landing State Park... Bunch... Baron... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 23 and 31, and between mile markers 35 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
